findings.title: RED - Redundant Event Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares the events `SwapAndLiquify` and `SwapTokensAtAmountUpdated` but they are not used in the contract. As a result, both events are redundant.

findings.title: CSD - Circulating Supply Discrepancy
findings.description: The contract does not return the totalSupply(). Instead, the function returns the totalSupply() minus the amount that has been moved to the dead address. This amount is the circulating supply of the token.

findings.title: RS - Redundant Struct
findings.description: The contract declares the `Taxes` struct along with the `taxes` variable. This variable is not being used in the contract. As a result, it is redundant.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions, but they are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure that the value of the state variable cannot be changed after it has been set.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.
